ETYMOLOGY: Short for gymnasium, from Latin gymnasium, from Ancient Greek γυμνάσιον (gumnásion, “public place for athletic exercises”), from γυμνάζω (gumnázō, “to train naked”), from γυμνός (gumnós, “naked”).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A place or club where people go to exercise and do physical training.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人们进行体育锻炼和体能训练的场所或俱乐部。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I try to go to the gym three times a week to stay fit.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我每周尽量去健身房三次以保持身材。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A school subject involving physical exercise and sports; physical education.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 学校里涉及体育锻炼和运动的科目；体育课。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We always had to run a mile during gym class.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在体育课上总是要跑一英里。

REGISTER: Informal and everyday usage, especially for the first meaning. 'Gymnasium' is more formal.
